nodes.bodyText: Double check these error strings with @hamiltonha
The error codes or the error messages?
Ok, I'll be sure to sync up with @hamiltonha as I add more error messages in the next PR.
I don't think these should live here. They should instead be in ErrorStrings.java
Also following the same pattern in that class, let's use complete variable names
+1 on this feedback, let's organize these constants into ErrorStrings

This is wrong as stated on CR on an earlier PR. This would use the BrokerMsalController if a broker is present on the device.
This should instead be getControllers() and loop over them to execute for each controller. For an example, see SilentTokenCommand.java

This is not supported in broker. so either we find a way to inject LocalMsalController as the default controller elsewhere, or we simply just hard code it here and add some comment.
Also, given that this is an interactive flow, I don't think we should loop through the controllers.

Then we should use getControllers().get(0) - The command object has at least one controller to begin with. In this case, that is the LocalMsalController as that is being supplied to the command during creation via the method in PCA

@shahzaibj getDefaultController() here actually points to a method in BaseController that simply calls controllers.get(0) (controllers being the object that would be returned by getControllers()), so it's the same code either way I think. And yes, since the command object was created with a LocalMsalController in PublicClientApplication, LocalMsalController should be the "default" controller.
@t-fadura Okay, I see. We have multiple methods called getDefaultController and each of them do different things. Thanks for pointing out.

Most of these properties are going to be unfamiliar to us, as we're just now adding support for DCF. Despite the other getters not having javadoc in this class, can I request we add it for these new methods? I think it's is particularly important to call out that these getters and their values will return null in non-DCF cases, and that these values may be applicable only in DC flows
It was left here from previous code by mistake, will remove
